question_text: If a book is bought for Rs. 150 and sold for Rs. 180, what is the profit?
A pen is purchased for Rs. 25 and sold for Rs. 20. Find the loss percent.
The cost price of an article is Rs. 500. If it is sold at a profit of 25%, what is the selling price?
A shopkeeper buys 10 apples for Rs. 100 and sells them at Rs. 12 each. What is his profit?
If the selling price is Rs. 90 and the cost price is Rs. 120, find the loss percent.
Calculate the profit percent if an item bought for Rs. 80 is sold for Rs. 100.
A toy is sold for Rs. 550 at a profit of 10%. What was its cost price?
A man incurs a loss of 5% by selling a watch for Rs. 1140. At what price should the watch be sold to earn a 5% profit?
The cost price of 15 articles is equal to the selling price of 12 articles. Find the gain percent.
If an article is sold at a 5% gain instead of a 5% loss, a man gains Rs. 5. What is the cost price of the article?
A shopkeeper offers a 10% discount on an item marked at Rs. 200. What is the selling price?
If a discount of 20% on the marked price of a shirt saves a man Rs. 150, how much did he pay for the shirt?
A man bought oranges at 6 for Rs. 20 and sold them at 4 for Rs. 18. Find his gain or loss percent.
By selling an article for Rs. 72, there is a loss of 10%. In order to gain 5%, its selling price should be:
The marked price of a watch is Rs. 1000. A retailer buys it at Rs. 810 after getting two successive discounts. If the first discount is 10%, what is the second discount rate?
A dishonest dealer professes to sell his goods at cost price, but he uses a weight of 960 g for the kg weight. Find his gain percent.
A sells an article to B at a gain of 10%. B sells it to C at a gain of 5%. If C pays Rs. 462 for it, what did it cost A?
A shopkeeper marks his goods 20% above the cost price and allows a discount of 10% on the marked price. What is his profit percent?
A man sold two horses for Rs. 1980 each. On one, he gained 10%, and on the other, he lost 10%. Find his total gain or loss.
The profit earned by selling an article for Rs. 900 is double the loss incurred when the same article is sold for Rs. 450. At what price should the article be sold to make a 25% profit?
If the cost price is 95% of the selling price, what is the profit percent?
A fruit seller buys lemons at 2 for a rupee and sells them at 5 for three rupees. His gain percent is:
A retailer buys a radio for Rs. 225. His overhead expenses are Rs. 15. He sells the radio for Rs. 300. The profit percent of the retailer is:
If the selling price of an article is doubled, the profit triples. Find the profit percent.
A vendor loses the selling price of 4 oranges on selling 36 oranges. His loss percent is:
A shopkeeper cheats to the extent of 10% while buying and 10% while selling, by using false weights. His total gain is:
After allowing a discount of 12% on the marked price of an article, it is sold for Rs. 880. Find its marked price.
A tradesman marks his goods at such a price that after allowing a discount of 15%, he makes a profit of 20%. What is the marked price of an article whose cost price is Rs. 170?
A bicycle is sold for Rs. 3600 at a loss of 10%. For what amount should it be sold to gain 15%?
The cost price of a radio is Rs. 1500. It was sold at a loss of 23%. Find the loss.
A shopkeeper sold an article for Rs. 2500. If the cost price of the article is Rs. 2000, find the profit percent.
By selling 100 notebooks, a shopkeeper gains the selling price of 20 notebooks. His gain percent is:
A man buys an article for 10% less than its value and sells it for 10% more than its value. His gain or loss percent is:
A man sold an article at a loss of 20%. If he had sold it for Rs. 12 more, he would have gained 10%. The cost price of the article is:
A person sells 3/4th of his goods at a profit of 20% and the rest at cost price. What is the gain earned by him in the whole transaction?
A dealer sold a machine for Rs. 7500 at a loss of 10%. What would be his profit percentage if he sold it for Rs. 9000?
The percentage profit earned on an article is the same as its cost price in rupees. If the selling price is Rs. 96, what is the cost price?
A shopkeeper mixes 26 kg of rice at Rs. 20 per kg with 30 kg of rice of another variety at Rs. 36 per kg and sells the mixture at Rs. 30 per kg. His profit percent is:
A milkman buys milk at Rs. 24 per litre, adds 1/3 of water to it, and sells the mixture at Rs. 28 per litre. What is his gain percent?
An article is sold at a certain price. If it were sold at 80% of that price, there would be a loss of 10%. What is the profit percentage when the article is sold at the original selling price?
A reduction of 20% in the price of sugar enables a purchaser to obtain 3 kg more for Rs. 120. The original price of sugar per kg was:
A shopkeeper sells a table at a profit of 20%. If he had bought it at 10% less cost and sold for Rs. 105 more, he would have gained 35%. The cost price of the table is:

A man buys two chairs for a total cost of Rs. 900. By selling one for 4/5 of its cost and the other for 5/4 of its cost, he makes a profit of Rs. 90 on the whole transaction. The cost of the low-priced chair is:

A shopkeeper allows a discount of 10% on the marked price of an item but charges a sales tax of 8% on the discounted price. If the customer pays Rs. 680.40 as the price including the sales tax, then what is the marked price of the item?
If goods be purchased for Rs. 450 and one-third be sold at a loss of 10%, at what gain percent should the remainder be sold so as to gain 20% on the whole transaction?

A manufacturer sells an item to a wholesale dealer at a profit of 18%. The wholesaler sells the same to a retailer at a profit of 20%. The retailer in turn sells it to a customer for Rs. 30,090 at a profit of 25%. The cost price of the manufacturer is:
An article passing through two hands is sold at a profit of 38% at the original cost price. If the first dealer makes a profit of 15%, what is the profit percent made by the second?
A cloth merchant says that due to a slump in the market, he sells the cloth at 10% loss, but he uses a false meter scale and actually gains 15%. Find the actual length of the scale.

A person bought some articles at the rate of 5 per rupee and the same number at the rate of 4 per rupee. He mixed both the types and sold at the rate of 9 for 2 rupees. In this business he suffered a loss of Rs. 3. The total number of articles bought by him was:
A shopkeeper purchased a table marked at Rs. 200 at successive discounts of 10% and 15% respectively. He spent Rs. 7 on transportation and sold the table for Rs. 208. Find his profit percent.
